result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Lynn May Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry Lynn May Jr in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Terry Lynn May Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court sets date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-03-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 08-03-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 SUPERVISION.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Terry Lynn May not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Defendant has a pending felony before Branch 04.  Branch 40 authorizes/accepts transfer for possible global resolution.  Court scheduled projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail

Defendant Terry Lynn May in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn; both appear by video.  Defendant Terry Lynn May in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer R. Blenski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 40. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving during pendency of case.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD: 
Defendant Terry Lynn May in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Terry Lynn May in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terry Lynn May appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
